analysis.raw_content:
The following information has been extracted from the provided image:

**Title:** Daylight plane

**Section Title:** Primary daylight plane (sides)

**Description of Daylight Plane:**
The daylight plane in conjunction with the setbacks & height limits, create an invisible tent intended to contain development on the lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light.

**Regulation Text:**
The primary daylight plane regulates structures located within the buildable area. Structures located in the rear and/or side yards are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plan described on the next page.

**Figure Caption:**
Fig 20 Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane

**Code Sections:**
*   Page 26: 18.12.040 (a) Table 2
*   Page 27: 18.04
*   Page 28: 18.12.040 (c) Table 2
*   Page 29: 18.12.050 (b) (2), 18.12.040 (j)

**Diagram Labels and Specifications:**
*   **Side lot line**
*   **10' from average grade**
*   **45°** (angle of the daylight plane)
*   **Max. allowed is Min. required by Building Code** (pointing to a vertical dimension)
*   **24' max. for protrusions** (vertical dimension from grade)
*   **Max. building height** (vertical dimension from grade)
*   **Average grade**
*   **Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot**
*   **Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall)**

**Notes:**
*   Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
*   Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Fig 44 p. 42).
*   Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
*   Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

**Page Number:** 26
